item.title: Accor hotels will be providing newspapers and magazines digitally starting in 2015
item.description: Accor, partnering with PressReader, is launching a complimentary information service across its hotel group by early 2015. This initiative aligns with Accor’s Leading Digital Hospitality strategy, focused on incorporating and enhancing digital aspects throughout the guest experience. Through “Accor Press by PressReader,” hotel guests can access over 3,000 international and local publications on their smartphones, laptops, or tablets, using various operating systems (iOS, Android, Blackberry, Windows). Guests can access “Accor Press by PressReader” through the hotel’s Wi-Fi, allowing them to download articles, newspapers, and magazines for offline reading.

item.title: Makani numbers in Dubai assist taxi drivers in locating their customers
item.description: Source: RTA. Dubai taxis are now connected to the city through the Makani system. Dubai’s Roads and Transport Authority (RTA) Public Transport Agency has successfully connected 4,500 taxis operated by franchise companies to the Dubai Municipality’s Makani System. This system utilizes unique coordinates, known as Makani numbers, for precise building location. Adel Shakri, Director of Transportation Systems at RTA’s Public Transport Agency, highlighted the significant role of the Makani System.

item.title: The book guarantees to save presentations from completely missing the mark
item.description: Presentations are a common way to share information, manage projects, and plan, taking up a significant part of the workweek. However, they often waste time and resources. Ed Gruwez, a Belgian communications expert, believes most presentations are ineffective and poorly designed, failing to achieve their goals despite considerable preparation time. He points out their negative impact on corporate decisions and employee satisfaction. Gruwez emphasizes the ubiquity of presentations in professional settings and the significant financial and time resources wasted on ineffective ones.

item.title: TalentBin by Monster searches through social networks to find potential candidates for recruitment
item.description: Source: Monster website. Monster recently launched its TalentBin platform across multiple regions to help businesses locate and engage skilled professionals. Functioning as a specialized search engine for talent, the software grants recruiters access to a pool of potential candidates who might not be easily discoverable through traditional methods. This is achieved by analyzing and leveraging professional information individuals share on various social media platforms. TalentBin not only automates and simplifies the process of identifying potential candidates through site monitoring, data interpretation, and profile matching but also makes hiring more efficient, allowing recruiters to achieve more in less time.
